definition: blunderer/bungler/also written 糊塗蟲|糊涂虫
non-Han people, esp. from central Asia/reckless/outrageous/what?/why?/to complete a winning hand at mahjong (also written 和[hu2])
to apply (paint etc)/to smear/to daub/to blot out/to scribble/to scrawl/(literary) mud/street
lower form of animal life, including insects, insect larvae, worms and similar creatures/CL:條|条[tiao2],隻|只[zhi1]/(fig.) person with a particular undesirable characteristic
ashamed and unable to show one's face (idiom)
to start on virtue but give up (idiom); to fail to carry things through/lack of sticking power/short attention span

lit. a tortoise laughing at a soft-shelled turtle for having no tail (idiom)/fig. the pot calling the kettle black
smell of mother's milk not yet dried (idiom); immature and inexperienced/still wet behind the ears
